input.style: width: 100%; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: -0.0625em 0px 0px; height: 1.25em; outline: none;

div.div: Vision: Spring-Ford Area School District will be the district that every parent would choose as their child's educational provider.
Spring-Ford’s nine school directors assess the district’s needs to develop an educational program that is consistent with the districts mission and vision.

Mission: Spring-Ford Area School District strives to be educationally relevant, focused on achievement and growth, and have a priority on people so that students are fully prepared to positively contribute to their society.

li.a: Spring City Elementary Hybrid Learning School

div.div: Visual arts, drama, athletics, after school activities, music and more. Extracurricular activities exist for all Spring-Ford students to succeed outside of the school day.
Dropdown content text. Aenean lacinia bibendum nulla sed consectetur. Nullam quis risus eget urna mollis ornare vel eu leo.

header.div: Learn more about becoming a volunteer!

li.a: March 11, 2020 - Important Update from Dr. Goodin

ul.li: Update from Montgomery County Office of Public Health
Frequently Asked Questions - focus on the future
RAMful Learning, Enrichment Activities, and more
Technology Updates and Home Device Survey

div.div:
COVID-19 Updates from SFASD April 1 - Daily Update: Food Service Dates, Expanded COVID Resources
April 2 - Daily Update: rAM Show, Final Laptop Distribution
April 3 - Daily Update: FERPA Reminder, Attendance information, School Board Committee Meetings
April 6 - Daily Update: Senior Yard Signs, School Board Committee Meetings, Mental Health Resource
April 9 - School Closure Update
April 13 - Food Service Reminder, Share a Good News Story
April 15 - School Board Meeting Dates, 5K Update
April 17 - Virtual Video Update, School Board Reminder
April 22 - Special Board Meeting, Commencement

p.strong: Starting Monday, March 30th teachers will be providing new instruction online using Google Classroom with the intent of advancing and moving the curriculum forward. Please know that we understand that this is going to be a transition for families, and we are stressing flexibility for families. Instruction will be asynchronous, which means that families will have flexibility as to when in the day they will complete their work.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

u.a: COVID Numbers Website Info for Public

ul.li: Drive-thru testing is now available in Montco - learn who is eligible here
Visit Montgomery County’s COVID-19 Data Hub & Office of Public Health websites for accurate local information
Visit the Pennsylvania Department of Health & CDC websites for accurate statewide and national information
Let the community know your needs via PA Link’s Provider Survey and/or the Tri-County Area Chamber of Commerce website

If applicable, learn useful strategies for working remotely via TCN’s Webinar
SAMHSA is providing regular updates via a new consolidated COVID-19 page: samhsa.gov/coronavirus
5-County SEPA region information for school meals during closures, please Click here
PA Parent and Family Alliance has been working hard to put together some useful resources for families and providers across the state. These resources include education, mental wellness, work, necessary services, art, relaxation and much more and we have more to add. Please visit their site by clicking here .
KIDSPEACE is offering the “24 WAYS YOU CAN PREVENT CHILD ABUSE” BROCHURE which is attached. Additionally, please check out this link detailing “Helpful Tips for Kids and Teens Dealing with Stress during this Crisis”… click here “
Southeast MHTTC invites you to a special webinar event entitled "COVID-19: Mental Health Challenges and Resilience" this Friday, April 3rd, at 10:00 AM ET. Register here.

p.strong: Creating Increased Connections Mutual Aid Groups

ul.li: To register, click here to join

Resources
Creating Increased Connections(CIC) Virtual Group Schedule
Guiding Your Child and/or Teen During Social Isolation Due To the COVID-19 Outbreak
COVID Numbers Website Info for Public
Virtual Alt2Su Groups - please click here
Offering virtual Recovery Support Groups, Family Support Groups, and Wellness Chats

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

p.strong: Center for Advocacy for the Rights & Interests of the Elderly (

ul.li: Reach out to CARIE with any concerns about those impacted by the pandemic and its many health, social, and economic consequences.

Transportation and Community HealthChoices specialists are available to assist with navigating: transportation for medical care, interruptions in in-home services, continued supplies of needed medications, etc. CARIE staff are working to keep our website up to date with current general info.

p.strong: Greater Harleysville and North Penn Senior Services

ul.li: If you need social services or other help, call PEAK Center, 215.362.7432, or Encore Experiences, 215.256.6900. Will return calls asap.
Offering members access to online home fitness classes and activities for the family. (Many older adult health insurance plans offer Silver Sneakers Y memberships at no cost.)

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

ul.li: Connecting individuals to benefits such as SNAP, health care, utility programs, unemployment benefits, etc.
Expecting an increase in newly eligible individuals given the economic conditions

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

p.strong: MontCo Hunger Solutions Emergency Food Map

ul.li: Has published an open google doc listing school district food distribution points for all of SE PA.
Willing to pick up food donations and drop off at food pantries in Willow Grove, Abington, and Roslyn.
Not able to offer or seek financial assistance for individuals currently.
Hours: Open daily 7 am to 2 pm.
People who wish to utilize the Roslyn pantry or donate, please call 267.318.0607 around 10 am to check the day's schedule.
Check website for pantry plans as they are available.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

ul.li:
Hours: Open daily 7 am to 2 pm.
Showers available 8 am to noon daily
Mail distributions 8 am to noon

div.p: Integrated Medical Transport Service (Serving Bucks-Mont area, et al)

ul.li: Temporarily providing public transportation during the COVID-19 crisis for a fee
Offers daily telecommuting tips as well as SEPTA updates.
Visit their FB page or sign up for updates via execdir@ptma-mc.org.

Also have a bike share at their Colmar office. Contact email above if a bike is needed to get to work. Proper ID, a helmet, and a signed waiver are necessary. If needed, PTMA can provide the helmet free.

u.a: Ways you can prevent child abuse

ul.li: Peer Resources to Manage Social Distancing
